intro: Acosta maculosa, commonly known as the spotted acosta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds. Acosta maculosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
